parameters.query:
WITH last_receipt AS (
  SELECT id FROM parsed_receipts
  WHERE telegram_id = '{{$('TG_Trigger').item.json.message.chat.id }}'
  ORDER BY created_at DESC
  LIMIT 1
)
UPDATE parsed_receipts
SET flagged = true
WHERE id IN (SELECT id FROM last_receipt);

json.title: Lensa hiring Functional Tester in New Carrollton, MD
json.dc:creator: LinkedIn
json.content:
Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, TestPros, is seeking professionals. Apply via Lensa today!

Company Overview

TestPros is a successful and growing business, established in 1988 to provide Information Technology (IT) technical support services to a wide range of Commercial and U.S. Federal, State, and Local Government customers. Our capabilities include Program Management, Program Oversight, Process Audit, Intelligence Analysis, Cyber Security, NIST SP 800-171 Assessment and Compliance, Computer Forensics, Software Assurance, Software Testing, Test Automation, Section 508 and WCAG Accessibility Assessment, Localization Testing, Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V), Quality Assurance (QA), Compliance, and Research and Development (R&D) services.TestPros is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

TestPros delivers innovative independent IT assessment solutions to critical challenges facing the nation and the world. We support the U.S. Federal Government and Commercial clients within the continental USA.TestPros is dedicated to making lives better, safer and more secure.

Citizenship:U.S. Citizenship

Location: Remote (and New Carrollton MD, some travel might be required)

Clearance:Public Trust Clearance

Project:The IRS requires contractor support to perform a variety of testing services, including Systems Acceptability Testing (SAT), Integration Testing, Performance Testing, and related support services like Test Automation and Test Data Management. These services ensure IRS applications and systems function as intended, comply with business requirements, and are free of defects before production implementation. The goal is to enhance the taxpayer experience by providing high-quality, accurate service.

The EST organization within IRS IT supports the modernization of tax processing systems, managing the software life cycle from requirements through to operations. The organization is responsible for executing applicable tests, tracking defects, and communicating results to stakeholders.

The IRS is evolving its testing methodologies to incorporate agile practices and extensive automation, supporting a modern, iterative approach to application delivery.

Responsibilities

Support IRS system acceptability testing (SAT) through execution of functional and integration tests.

Develop and execute test cases for IRS tax applications.

Conduct white-box, black-box, and regression testing.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (preferred).
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in software testing, with a focus on functional testing
  • Proven experience in functional testing, integration testing, and test automation.
  • Working knowledge of agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum).Familiarity with Agile, test case design, and defect tracking.
  • Familiarity with IRS testing methodologies (e.g., SAT, FIT) is a plus.
  • 5+ years functional testing experience.
  • Must be eligible to obtain a US security clearance.
  • IRS experience

Benefits and Perks

TestPros offers competitive salary, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, 3 weeks of paid vacation, 2 weeks of paid federal holidays, education/training and professional certifications, 401(k) retirement plan with up to 4% company match, opportunities for professional growth and much more! All benefits are per TestPros current policies and are subject to change without notice. Benefits are available to full-time employees only.

Powered by JazzHR

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

json.creator: LinkedIn
json.title: Perfected Claims hiring Head of Product and Technology in Tampa, FL
json.dc:creator: LinkedIn
json.content:
Perfected Claims is looking for a Head of Product and Technology to support its mission and shape the future of how justice is delivered at scale.

Location Note: Onsite in St. Thomas, USVI or as a remote position in a state in which Perfected Claims LLC or Strategic Campaign Sourcing LLC is registered to do business (FL, GA, SC, NC, NY, NJ, NV, HI, TX, CA, OH,PA, LA, IL, ME, TN, AL, VA, KY, and WI). Preference will be given to qualified candidates who live in – or are willing to work in – the USVI or Eastern time zone.

The Head of Product and Technology will lead the strategic planning and execution of our product vision while overseeing the technical teams delivering it. Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, this leader is responsible for shaping the product roadmap, guiding software engineering execution, and managing the systems, tools, and vendors that support both internal operations and external customer experiences. This position will directly manage the Director of Application Development, Developers, and Product Managers. This role blends strong product management experience—ideally in the legal industry—with technical oversight and organizational leadership. The ideal candidate brings a product-first mindset with enough technical fluency to guide cross-functional teams across the full software development lifecycle.

What You’ll Lead

Product Strategy and Roadmap Ownership

  • Drive the roadmap for our Perfected Platform, including the intake, case validation, communication, and reporting tools that power our legal services
  • Build out the future of our client portal — an experience that’s clear, compassionate, and empowering
  • Lead integration between Perfected and Erin Brockovich’s new company, launching in 2026 — including a consumer health app that will connect people to environmental justice in real-time
  • Connect cross-functional needs into a single, living product vision that keeps us nimble, compliant, and human-centered
  • Enhance reporting capabilities by developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports, leveraging the organization's robust data warehouse to deliver actionable insights and support data-driven decision making

Tech Leadership That Supports Real Work

  • Manage and evolve a high-performing internal team:
    • Director of Application Development
    • Developers
    • Product Manager
    • Technical Program Manager
  • Coordinate expansion efforts with development firm to manage and enhance our existing platform. You’ll play a key role in shaping its future direction and driving product and technology strategy forward
  • Oversee system performance, scalability, and integration across Salesforce, AWS-hosted custom services, DataWarehouse technologies (i.e. “core platform”), marketing sites, legacy applications, and operations tools
  • Guide architectural decisions and technical tradeoffs across a diverse stack, ensuring solutions are secure, scalable, and cost-effective

Continuous Improvement and Execution

  • Own the way our platform adapts to change — whether it’s new case types, new partners, or new compliance needs
  • Build better analytics and reporting to drive smarter legal action
  • Support our frontline operations and legal teams with tools that truly make their jobs easier

Budget and Vendor Management

  • Manage departmental budgets for technology and product functions, including CapEx/OpEx planning
  • Lead vendor selection, negotiation, and relationship management for SaaS tools, cloud services, and external development partners

Corporate Compliance and Risk Management

  • Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, CCPA) and maintain a strong posture around cybersecurity and system resilience
  • Oversee business continuity planning, access controls, and documentation of system operations and procedures

Customer Support and Help Desk Oversight

  • Manage an external help desk team responsible for supporting our internal teams
  • Monitor support performance and drive continuous improvement in ticketing systems, documentation, and escalation processes

Our Technology Environment

Candidates should bring hands-on experience with—or the ability to quickly ramp up on—a range of technologies that support our business operations and product platforms:

  • Salesforce (preferred): Familiarity with platform customization, automation, and third-party integrations
  • Data Warehousing Tools: Experience supporting or implementing platforms such as DBT (preferred), Snowflake, Redshift, or similar
  • Data Reporting & Visualization: Comfort working with tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker to enable data-driven decisions
  • Cloud Infrastructure (AWS): Understanding of how to leverage AWS services for scalable application hosting, storage, and analytics
  • Custom Applications & APIs: Familiarity with custom development environments, ideally in Python and RESTful API architecture, even if not hands-on
  • Legacy Tools: Motivation to understand how File Maker Pro, which will be sunset in the near future, handles our claims administration for an older tort. Other off-the-shelf tools like docusign and formstack handle portions of the user journey - which you will need to evolve over time

Who You Are

  • Product-Led. You live for user impact. You care about intuitive experiences, scalable systems, and sweating the details — because someone’s livelihood might depend on it
  • Solution-Oriented. You say “Yes, AND” or “Yes, BUT.” You see obstacles as creative constraints, not dead ends
  • Calm in Chaos. You thrive in an environment where plans change, priorities shift, and the stakes are high
  • Builder & Refiner. You love to ship, but also to refactor. You believe MVPs and excellence can coexist
  • Servant Leader. You believe leadership means lifting others. You love watching your team win
  • Mission-Driven. You want your work to matter — to make the world more fair, more just, more human

What You Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field
  • 8+ years of experience in Product, Technology, or Engineering leadership roles
  • 3+ years managing cross-functional teams, including developers and product managers
  • Salesforce platform experience (preferred)
  • Comfort working with both internal users and external engineering partners
  • Strong technical fluency — enough to question assumptions, propose options, and drive decisions
  • Experience with platforms like Snowflake, AWS, Tableau/Looker/Power BI a plus
  • Legal-tech or legal operations experience preferred, but not required
  • Deep empathy and strong communication skills

Physical Requirements

  • Frequent need for oral, written, and auditory communication
  • Prolonged periods working on a computer
  • Ability to sit for long periods of time
  • Frequent repetitive hand and wrist motions
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and sometimes stressful services environment
  • Occasional need for travel

Salary Range: $180,000-$220,000 per year

This position description should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties as may be required. Perfected Claims LLC and/or Strategic Campaign Sourcing LLC have the right to revise this position description at any time.

Perfected Claims LLC and Strategic Campaign Sourcing LLC are equal opportunity employers.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please contact us at talent@perfectedclaims.com or you may call us at 340-423-7199 and ask for Human Resources.

Powered by JazzHR

json.title: Lumata Health hiring VP of Engineering (Remote) in Raleigh, NC
json.dc:creator: LinkedIn
json.content:
Position: VP of Engineering

Job Type: Exempt - Full-time

Schedule: Monday to Friday 9am-6pm EST

Reports to: Chief Technology Officer

Eligibility Requirement: Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship

This role is remote (Occasional quarterly travel may be necessary)

Summary

We are seeking a hands-on, player-coach VP Engineering leader to lead Lumata’s engineering function into its next phase of engineering, intelligence, and delivery excellence. You will set technical best practices, work closely with engineers, product team, and be deeply involved in system design, development, engineering operations, and GenAI adoption.

This role will help define Lumata’s technology identity, instill engineering rigor, and foster a culture of excellence that combines pragmatic execution with long-term architectural thinking. You will lead platform development, AI enablement, and technical delivery across products and services.

Essential Functions

Engineering Leadership & Delivery

  • Lead the engineering function across full-stack, UI, backend, platform, QA/SDET, and DevOps teams.
  • Act as a player-coach—partnering with product, cross functional teams and ICs while modeling strong technical judgment
  • Promote engineering rigor through planning, Secure-SDLC, design reviews, code reviews, test automation, documentation practices, and CI/CD excellence.

Generative AI Adoption & Integration

  • Lead Lumata’s GenAI engineering effort—building internal tools and customer-facing GenAI products.
  • Use GenAI to accelerate internal development, deployment, and compliance workflows.
  • Design and implement AI-augmented delivery workflows, blending human engineers with AI agents.
  • Collaborate with Product and Data to drive GenAI experimentation and impact measurement.

Platform & Technology Development + Production SRE

  • Implement platform strategy across Salesforce Health Cloud, AWS (Connect, Glue, Lambdas, Data Lake), and EHR integrations with our customers.
  • Own security first, public strength APIs, platform modularity, extensibility, and scale to support diverse GTMs and needs.
  • Champion DevSecOps, infrastructure-as-code, observability, secure, compliant deployment practices and ability to troubleshoot and resolve urgent production issues.

Team Building & People Leadership

  • Lead a lean blended team of employees and contractors with clear ownership, accountability, and collaboration norms.
  • Design an engineering org that stays lean and high-impact by leveraging automation and GenAI agents where possible.
  • Establish clear roles, impact areas, and growth paths to attract and retain top engineering talent.

Engineering, IT Operations & Metrics

  • Track and continuously improve engineering health using DORA, Engineering, Quality and GenAI adoption metrics.
  • Build delivery systems and team structures that improve speed, reliability, and confidence across releases.
  • Operate at the intersection of technology leadership, operational excellence, and AI-driven transformation.

Education And Experience

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • 15+ years of engineering experience with at least 5 years in a technical leadership role.
  • Proven experience in developing high performance engineering teams and platforms in a high-growth, scale up environment.
  • Demonstrated success in building and integrating GenAI technologies and infrastructure.
  • Experience working in healthtech, HIPAA-compliant environments, SOC-2 Type 2 or platform businesses is a strong plus.
  • Designed and developed solutions for internal efficiencies or external solutions

Required Skills

  • Strong full-stack system design, end-to-end development skills, Secure-SDLC.
  • Hands-on coding experience in one or more major language (e.g., JS, Java, python, etc)
  • Experienced building Cloud SaaS solutions with Salesforce (Apex, LWC), AWS services, Mobile apps and DevOps/SRE practices.
  • Deep understanding of CI/CD, DevOps, Security, cloud-native architecture, and continuous deployment.
  • Proven ability to build lean, high-performing teams—blended across contractors, employees, and timezones.
  • Comfortable driving tech roadmaps, leading delivery, reviews and digging into details when needed.
  • Metrics and data driven decision making and planning skills (DORA, etc).
  • Strong communicator and collaborator, able to influence across Product, Data, Clinical Ops, and Executive teams.
  • Mindset and hands on experience for innovation and an eye for practical, scalable GenAI application design and development.
  • Leveraging GenAI for scaling internal efficiency and external solutions (Preferred)

Physical Requirements

  • Must have a home office that is secure and free of distractions (HIPAA-compliant workspace)
  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
  • Must be able to hear, speak, call and virtually meet
  • Must be able to communicate both verbally and in writing

Work Environment

In order to perform the essential functions of this job, you must have a dedicated remote workspace, and a wireless connection with a minimum of 50 Mbps of download speed and 10 Mbps of upload speed of dedicated internet bandwidth for each person working from home; the workspace is private and has low to no noise level as you will be on phone calls with patients. It is very important that your workspace is HIPAA compliant; your company issued laptop/pc must maintain visibility that only you can access as you'll be handling patient data. You are also expected to have your camera on during virtual meetings, therefore, you must be in a designated workspace/room for privacy.

The above statements are intended to describe the essential functions of the job being performed by the employees assigned to this classification. The duties and responsibilities listed are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. With the evolution of the organization and this role, the responsibilities of this position may change at any time.

Benefits

At Lumata Health, we know you are more than just an employee. As we grow, so will our benefits package. We hope you’ll be a part of that growth!

  • Medical, Dental and Vision
  • Paid time off
  • Parental leave
  • ... more additional benefits

Our Culture

At Lumata, we foster a dynamic, inclusive, and supportive remote work environment. We prioritize trust, collaboration, and continuous learning, ensuring a healthy work-life balance.

Collaboration: Stay connected through regular team meetings and open communication.

Inclusivity: A diverse team where everyone feels welcome and valued.

Fun Culture: Engage in chats centered around health, wellness, celebrations, and more.

Recognition: Regular feedback, performance incentives, and growth opportunities.

Join Lumata and be part of a forward-thinking, remote-first team where your contributions make a difference, and your well-being is prioritized.

Who We’re Looking For

  • Mission driven
  • Curious
  • Loves learning and developing skills
  • Team player (though we understand you need focus time, too)

Why Join Us? At Lumata Health, you’ll be part of a forward-thinking team that is dedicated to reshaping the future of healthcare. We offer comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional development. Join us in making a significant impact on patient care and engagement.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. All individuals are encouraged to apply. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at: hr@lumatahealth.com (no unsolicited resumes please). Applicants must submit an application with Lumata Health to be considered for the position.

Important Notice

This position does not require a credit report or the submission of any financial information during the application process. Official communications regarding applications and positions will only be sent from an email address ending in @lumatahealth.com. If you receive any communication about your application from an email not ending in @lumatahealth.com, it is fraudulent. Below are some website options where you can report such activity: consumerfinance.gov, reportfraud.ftc.gov, ic3.gov, https://www.usa.gov/where-report-scams

Please be advised that Lumata Health only accepts resumes for compensation from agencies that have a signed agreement with Lumata Health. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Lumata Health. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

Disclaimer

This job description is subject to change based on business needs, advancements in regulations, and workflow adjustments. Continuous review and adjustments will be made to ensure alignment with the company's goals and objectives.

json.title: SquareTrade hiring Business Analyst in Brisbane, CA
json.dc:creator: LinkedIn
json.content:
Company Description

SquareTrade is the fastest growing company of its kind. We’re revolutionizing a $30b industry with service innovation and attention to customer satisfaction. We partner with some of the largest, most sophisticated retailers and carriers in the world (Walmart, Target, Amazon, Costco, and T-Mobile to name a few), consistently win industry awards, have received tens of thousands of 5-star reviews… and we’re just getting started. A member of the Allstate family, SquareTrade has headquarters in San Francisco and London. We are currently expanding in Europe and Asia Pacific, including Japan and Australia.

Job Description

Our Financial Analytics team combines the functions of data analytics, business intelligence, and financial planning. We take an end-to-end view of the businesses’ operations and finances. The team has a wide variety of responsibilities: company-wide business intelligence, reporting, dashboard development, forecasting and budgeting, risk management, pricing, and decision support for various business units. We use complex modeling to build connective tissue between raw data and financial performance.

We are seeking an analyst who will work in the business intelligence & data analysis segment of the team, focusing on growth initiatives both in the U.S. and globally. Qualified candidates will have experience developing exceedingly complex financial models in Excel, crafting their own SQL queries and tables, and constructing thorough dashboards using BI visualization tools (e.g. Tableau). This position will also provide other ad hoc analyses and data as needed. This role provides opportunities to work on challenging projects with virtually every team in the company, requiring the employee to use their creativity and analytical skills to craft solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • In-depth exploration of causes and trends to identify problems/opportunities
  • Utilization of financial models that simulate and forecast business elements
  • Creation and redesign of dashboards and their underlying data structures to support the needs of various teams
  • Quantification of uncertainty and statistical variance in projections/scenarios
  • Ad hoc support of the sales, finance, and operational departments
  • Improve processes for current reporting, automation, frequency, and efficiency
  • Ensure integrity of financial models, reporting, and databases
  • Assisting on major company growth/expansion opportunities
  • Building out various in-depth reporting with Tableau
  • Developing complex Excel models to glean insight into company operations
  • Optimizing pricing on new and existing products in conjunction with Business Development
  • Monitoring and managing company risk
  • Providing financial and analytical support to drive the Executive team’s operating decisions

Qualifications

  • 2-5 years of work experience as an analyst, or similar position
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field is required
  • Advanced degree (i.e.: an MBA or Masters in an analytics-oriented field) is a plus
  • Familiarity with operational and financial modeling is required
  • Strong SQL skills and experience working with large data volumes required
  • Hands-on experience with BI reporting tools required (Tableau preferred)

An Ideal Candidate would also have/be :

  • Strong writing, presentation, and organizational skills
  • Ability to set and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Above all: self-driven and demonstratively motivated to make an impact

Additional Information

At SquareTrade you'll have access to:

  • Medical, dental and vision coverage with network optionality to support our dispersed workforce
  • HSAs and FSAs
  • Open access to mental health benefits including 1:1 therapy, coaching sessions and digital resources
  • $75 monthly allowance to support self-care and well-being
  • Up to 4% company match into 401(k)
  • Supportive leave policies including paid parental, grieving and loss, and domestic violence protected leaves
  • Paid Time Off
  • Work flexibility
  • Talent shares
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Learning opportunities
  • Hybrid work arrangements
  • $80 monthly internet connectivity stipend
  • Various corporate perks and discounts

The Team: http://www.squaretrade.com/leadership

(California Only) Pursuant to applicable law, SquareTrade estimates the possible base compensation for this role, if hired in California, to be within the following range: $90K-$110K

(Colorado Only) Pursuant to applicable law, SquareTrade estimates the possible base compensation for this role, if hired in Colorado, to be within the following range: $67K-$92K

SquareTrade is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees. We celebrate diversity and encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or ability status.

Thank you for your interest in a career at SquareTrade. Throughout your job search, please be mindful of recruitment fraud.

json.title: Legion Technologies hiring Head of AI Engineering in Palo Alto, CA
json.dc:creator: LinkedIn
json.content:
Remote, United States

JOB OVERVIEW

We are seeking a forward-looking and deeply technical Head of AI Engineering to lead all AI initiatives at Legion. This executive will oversee the AI Engineering organization—including both our applied ML and data science functions—and be responsible for driving innovation across traditional and generative AI domains. This role is critical to shaping Legion's product strategy, internal development practices, and long-term AI vision.

The ideal candidate combines deep technical expertise with strong organizational leadership and has a passion for applying AI to real-world enterprise challenges.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

  • Scale and Mature Traditional AI Capabilities
  • Lead continued innovation in Legion's ML-based forecasting, labor optimization, and demand modeling engines.
  • Ensure ongoing performance, scalability, and explainability for AI in production across large enterprise deployments.
  • Support product, sales, and customer success teams on high-impact opportunities where AI drives differentiation.
  • Define and Build Generative AI Experiences
  • Own the exploration, prototyping, and launch of generative AI features that transform how users engage with Legion's platform.
  • Partner with product, design, and engineering leadership to ensure these features are intuitive, secure, and highly impactful.
  • Drive AI-Enabled Transformation Across Engineering
  • Lead internal transformation efforts to embed AI into the software development lifecycle (e.g., AI agents, code generation, automated QA).
  • Promote best practices and enablement for AI-first engineering across all product teams.
  • Own Data Science and Applied Research
  • Oversee a cross-functional team of data scientists, ML engineers, and research specialists.
  • Foster a culture of experimentation, responsible AI practices, and measurable impact.
  • Evangelize AI Vision and Practices
  • Represent Legion's AI strategy with strategic customers, internal stakeholders, and industry forums as needed.
  • Serve as a thought partner to the executive team on how AI can accelerate product and company growth.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

  • 10+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering and data science, with 5+ years in leadership roles.
  • Proven experience scaling production-grade ML systems and owning the full lifecycle of AI products.
  • Deep expertise in both traditional ML and modern generative AI technologies (e.g., LLMs, RAG pipelines, embeddings, prompt engineering).
  • Strong technical foundation in software engineering and cloud-native architecture.
  • Ability to lead highly technical teams while collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering, and go-to-market leaders.
  • Experience translating complex AI capabilities into customer value.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and align at all levels of the organization.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND ATTRIBUTES

  • Experience in workforce management, enterprise SaaS, or operational technologies.
  • Experience leading AI innovation in a high-growth or startup environment.
  • Track record of publishing, contributing to open-source AI projects, or speaking at industry events.

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

Salary Range: Base Salary Range $200,000 - $300,000 + Bonus + Stock Equity

At Legion, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to all employees. As a fully remote employer, pay for positions is determined using local, national, and industry-specific survey data.

Our posted salary range is done so in good faith based on national data and may be refined for a candidate's region/town/cost of living. We strive to make competitive offers allowing employees room for future growth. Salaries will be based on the applicant's location, level of experience, education, and specialized knowledge and skills. Additionally, we consider the external market rate, the amount we have budgeted internally, and internal equity within the company for the same position.

Benefits include, but are not limited to:

  • $0 monthly premium and other flexible medical, dental, and vision plans are effective on the first day of employment
  • 401k plan
  • Discretionary Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
  • Parental Leave
  • Equity
  • Monthly Wellness Reimbursement
  • Monthly Lunch at Legion

ABOUT LEGION

Join Legion's mission to turn hourly jobs into good jobs. We're a remote, mission-driven team seeking exceptional talent to propel this vision. Embrace a culture that's collaborative, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial. With us, you'll grow your skills, work closely with experienced executives, and contribute significantly to our mission. Our award-winning AI-native workforce management platform is intelligent, automated, and employee-centric and has proven to deliver 13x ROI. We help labor-intensive organizations maximize labor efficiency and employee engagement simultaneously. Legion has earned recognition for its innovation, including spots on the Inc. 5000 list, Forbes' Next Billion Dollar Startups, and awards for our AI technology. Backed by leading investors such as Norwest Venture Partners, Stripes, First Round Capital, XYZ Ventures, Webb Investment Network, Workday Ventures, and NTT DOCOMO Ventures, we're making real change.

If you're ready to make an impact and grow your career, Legion is where you belong. Join us in making hourly work rewarding and fulfilling.

BACKGROUND AND OPPORTUNITY

There are almost 75 million hourly workers in the United States, representing more than half of the entire workforce. Historically, managing hourly employees has been difficult due to high attrition (average of 60%) and high replacement costs (average of $3,200 per employee in retail). The ongoing labor shortage and competition from the gig economy, make it more difficult to attract and retain hourly employees. The top reasons hourly employees leave their jobs are a lack of schedule empowerment, poor communication with employers, and an inability to get paid early. Gen Z and the millennial workforce demand gig-like flexibility, modern technology, and compelling work options. Legion's mission is to turn hourly jobs into good jobs, serving the hourly workers who make up the majority of the US workforce. We believe in empowering employees and helping employers be efficient and innovative by enabling intelligent automation powered by Legion's Workforce Management platform to optimize labor efficiency and enhance the employee experience simultaneously. Legion WFM was built for the cloud with AI at the core and designed to handle the complexity of modern businesses and meet the needs of today's hourly employees. Our team is comprised of dedicated individuals from all backgrounds and experiences, globally distributed across all time zones.

For more information, visit https://legion.co

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Legion Technologies is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.

DISABILITY ACCOMMODATION

For individuals with disabilities who need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please email recruiting@legion.co

Legion is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran, disability status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

How We Determine What We Pay

As a fully remote employer, Legion determines pay for positions using local, national, and industry-specific survey data. We evaluate external equity and the cost of labor/prevailing wage index in the relative marketplace for jobs directly comparable to jobs within our company. Our posted salary range is based on national data and may be refined for a candidate's region/town/cost of living. For new hires, we strive to make competitive offers allowing the new employee room for future growth. Salaries will be based on the applicant's location, level of experience, education, and specialized knowledge and skills. Additionally, we consider the external market rate, the amount we have budgeted internally, and internal equity within the company for the same position. An employee/candidate with a stronger skill set will receive higher pay.

Job Applicant Privacy Policy

This Job Applicant Privacy Policy ("Policy") describes how Legion Technologies, Inc. ("Legion", "we", "us" and "our") collects, uses, and discloses "personal information" as defined under California law from and about job applicants who are residents of California.

This Policy does not apply to our handling of data gathered about you in your role as a user of our consumer-facing services. When you interact with us as in that role, the Legion Privacy Policy applies.

  • Types of Personal Information We Handle

We collect, store, and use various types of personal information through the application and recruitment process. We collect such information either directly from you or (where applicable) from another person or entity, such as an employment agency or consultancy, background check provider, or other referral sources. This information includes:

  • Identification and contact information, and related identifiers such as full name, date and place of birth, citizenship and permanent residence, home and business addresses, telephone numbers, email addresses, and such information about your beneficiaries or emergency contacts.
  • Professional or employment-related information, including:
    • Recruitment, employment, or engagement information such as application forms and information included in a resume, cover letter, or otherwise provided through any application or engagement process; and copies of identification documents, such as driver's licenses, passports, and visas; and background screening results and references.
    • Career information such as job titles; work history; work dates and work locations; information about skills, qualifications, experience, publications, speaking engagements, and preferences; and professional memberships
  • Education Information such as institutions attended, degrees, certifications, training courses, publications, and transcript information.
  • Legally protected classification information such as race, sex/gender, religious/ philosophical beliefs, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital status, military service, nationality, ethnicity, request for family care leave, political opinions, and criminal history.
  • Other information such as any information you voluntarily choose to provide in connection with your job application.
  • How We Use Personal Information

We collect, use, share, and store personal information from job applicants for our and our service providers' business and operational purposes in the recruitment process such as: processing your application, tracking your application through the recruitment process, contacting references with your authorization, conducting background checks you authorize, and making hiring decisions. We will also use job applicant information for internal analysis purposes to understand the applicants who apply and to improve our recruitment process. We may sometimes need to use applicant information for legal purposes, such as in connection with any challenges made to our hiring decisions.

  • With Whom We Share Personal Information

We will disclose job applicant personal information to the following types of entities or in the following circumstances (where applicable):

  • Internally: to other Legion personnel involved in the recruiting and hiring process.
  • Vendors: such as technology service providers, travel management providers, human resources suppliers, background check companies, and employment agencies or recruiters, where applicable.
  • Legal Compliance: when required to do so by law, regulation, or court order or in response to a request for assistance by the police or other law enforcement agency.
  • Litigation Purposes: to seek legal advice from our external lawyers or in connection with litigation with a third party.
  • Business Transaction Purposes: in connection with the sale, purchase, or merger.
  • How to Contact Us About this Policy – If you have any questions about this Policy, please contact privacy@legion.co.

Remote, United States
JOB OVERVIEW
We are seeking a forward-looking and deeply technical Head of AI Engineering to lead all AI initiatives at Legion. This executive will oversee the AI Engineering organization—including both our applied ML and data science functions—and be responsible for driving innovation across traditional and generative AI domains. This role is critical to shaping Legion's product strategy, internal development practices, and long-term AI vision.
The ideal candidate combines deep technical expertise with strong organizational leadership and has a passion for applying AI to real-world enterprise challenges.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

 Scale and Mature Traditional AI Capabilities
Lead continued innovation in Legion's ML-based forecasting, labor optimization, and demand modeling engines.
Ensure ongoing performance, scalability, and explainability for AI in production across large enterprise deployments.
Support product, sales, and customer success teams on high-impact opportunities where AI drives differentiation.
 Define and Build Generative AI Experiences
Own the exploration, prototyping, and launch of generative AI features that transform how users engage with Legion's platform.
Partner with product, design, and engineering leadership to ensure these features are intuitive, secure, and highly impactful.
 Drive AI-Enabled Transformation Across Engineering
Lead internal transformation efforts to embed AI into the software development lifecycle (e.g., AI agents, code generation, automated QA).
Promote best practices and enablement for AI-first engineering across all product teams.
 Own Data Science and Applied Research
Oversee a cross-functional team of data scientists, ML engineers, and research specialists.
Foster a culture of experimentation, responsible AI practices, and measurable impact.
 Evangelize AI Vision and Practices
Represent Legion's AI strategy with strategic customers, internal stakeholders, and industry forums as needed.
Serve as a thought partner to the executive team on how AI can accelerate product and company growth.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

10+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering and data science, with 5+ years in leadership roles.
Proven experience scaling production-grade ML systems and owning the full lifecycle of AI products.
Deep expertise in both traditional ML and modern generative AI technologies (e.g., LLMs, RAG pipelines, embeddings, prompt engineering).
Strong technical foundation in software engineering and cloud-native architecture.
Ability to lead highly technical teams while collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering, and go-to-market leaders.
Experience translating complex AI capabilities into customer value.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and align at all levels of the organization.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND ATTRIBUTES

Experience in workforce management, enterprise SaaS, or operational technologies.
Experience leading AI innovation in a high-growth or startup environment.
Track record of publishing, contributing to open-source AI projects, or speaking at industry events.

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS
Salary Range: Base Salary Range $200,000 - $300,000 + Bonus + Stock Equity
At Legion, we offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to all employees. As a fully remote employer, pay for positions is determined using local, national, and industry-specific survey data.
Our posted salary range is done so in good faith based on national data and may be refined for a candidate's region/town/cost of living. We strive to make competitive offers allowing employees room for future growth. Salaries will be based on the applicant's location, level of experience, education, and specialized knowledge and skills. Additionally, we consider the external market rate, the amount we have budgeted internally, and internal equity within the company for the same position.
Benefits include, but are not limited to:

$0 monthly premium and other flexible medical, dental, and vision plans are effective on the first day of employment
401k plan
Discretionary Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
Parental Leave 
Equity 
Monthly Wellness Reimbursement
Monthly Lunch at Legion

ABOUT LEGION
Join Legion's mission to turn hourly jobs into good jobs. We're a remote, mission-driven team seeking exceptional talent to propel this vision. Embrace a culture that's collaborative, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial. With us, you'll grow your skills, work closely with experienced executives, and contribute significantly to our mission. Our award-winning AI-native workforce management platform is intelligent, automated, and employee-centric and has proven to deliver 13x ROI. We help labor-intensive organizations maximize labor efficiency and employee engagement simultaneously. Legion has earned recognition for its innovation, including spots on the Inc. 5000 list, Forbes' Next Billion Dollar Startups, and awards for our AI technology. Backed by leading investors such as Norwest Venture Partners, Stripes, First Round Capital, XYZ Ventures, Webb Investment Network, Workday Ventures, and NTT DOCOMO Ventures, we're making real change.
If you're ready to make an impact and grow your career, Legion is where you belong. Join us in making hourly work rewarding and fulfilling.
BACKGROUND AND OPPORTUNITY 
There are almost 75 million hourly workers in the United States, representing more than half of the entire workforce. Historically, managing hourly employees has been difficult due to high attrition (average of 60%) and high replacement costs (average of $3,200 per employee in retail). The ongoing labor shortage and competition from the gig economy, make it more difficult to attract and retain hourly employees. The top reasons hourly employees leave their jobs are a lack of schedule empowerment, poor communication with employers, and an inability to get paid early.       Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, TestPros, is seeking professionals. Apply via Lensa today!

      Company Overview

      TestPros is a successful and growing business, established in 1988 to provide Information Technology (IT) technical support services to a wide range of Commercial and U.S. Federal, State, and Local Government customers. Our capabilities include Program Management, Program Oversight, Process Audit, Intelligence Analysis, Cyber Security, NIST SP 800-171 Assessment and Compliance, Computer Forensics, Software Assurance, Software Testing, Test Automation, Section 508 and WCAG Accessibility Assessment, Localization Testing, Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V), Quality Assurance (QA), Compliance, and Research and Development (R&D) services.TestPros is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

      TestPros delivers innovative independent IT assessment solutions to critical challenges facing the nation and the world. We support the U.S. Federal Government and Commercial clients within the continental USA.TestPros is dedicated to making lives better, safer and more secure.

      Citizenship:U.S. Citizenship

      Location: Remote (and New Carrollton MD, some travel might be required)

      Clearance:Public Trust Clearance

      Project:The IRS requires contractor support to perform a variety of testing services, including Systems Acceptability Testing (SAT), Integration Testing, Performance Testing, and related support services like Test Automation and Test Data Management. These services ensure IRS applications and systems function as intended, comply with business requirements, and are free of defects before production implementation. The goal is to enhance the taxpayer experience by providing high-quality, accurate service.

      The EST organization within IRS IT supports the modernization of tax processing systems, managing the software life cycle from requirements through to operations. The organization is responsible for executing applicable tests, tracking defects, and communicating results to stakeholders.

      The IRS is evolving its testing methodologies to incorporate agile practices and extensive automation, supporting a modern, iterative approach to application delivery.

      Responsibilities

      Support IRS system acceptability testing (SAT) through execution of functional and integration tests.

      Develop and execute test cases for IRS tax applications.

      Conduct white-box, black-box, and regression testing.

      Qualifications

      • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (preferred).
      • Minimum 5 years of experience in software testing, with a focus on functional testing
      • Proven experience in functional testing, integration testing, and test automation.
      • Working knowledge of agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum).Familiarity with Agile, test case design, and defect tracking.
      • Familiarity with IRS testing methodologies (e.g., SAT, FIT) is a plus.
      • 5+ years functional testing experience.
      • Must be eligible to obtain a US security clearance.
      • IRS experience

      Benefits and Perks

      TestPros offers competitive salary, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, 3 weeks of paid vacation, 2 weeks of paid federal holidays, education/training and professional certifications, 401(k) retirement plan with up to 4% company match, opportunities for professional growth and much more! All benefits are per TestPros current policies and are subject to change without notice. Benefits are available to full-time employees only.

      Perfected Claims is looking for a Head of Product and Technology to support its mission and shape the future of how justice is delivered at scale.

      Location Note: Onsite in St. Thomas, USVI or as a remote position in a state in which Perfected Claims LLC or Strategic Campaign Sourcing LLC is registered to do business (FL, GA, SC, NC, NY, NJ, NV, HI, TX, CA, OH,PA, LA, IL, ME, TN, AL, VA, KY, and WI). Preference will be given to qualified candidates who live in – or are willing to work in – the USVI or Eastern time zone.

      The Head of Product and Technology will lead the strategic planning and execution of our product vision while overseeing the technical teams delivering it. Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, this leader is responsible for shaping the product roadmap, guiding software engineering execution, and managing the systems, tools, and vendors that support both internal operations and external customer experiences. This position will directly manage the Director of Application Development, Developers, and Product Managers. This role blends strong product management experience—ideally in the legal industry—with technical oversight and organizational leadership. The ideal candidate brings a product-first mindset with enough technical fluency to guide cross-functional teams across the full software development lifecycle.

      What You’ll Lead

      Product Strategy and Roadmap Ownership

      • Drive the roadmap for our Perfected Platform, including the intake, case validation, communication, and reporting tools that power our legal services
      • Build out the future of our client portal — an experience that’s clear, compassionate, and empowering
      • Lead integration between Perfected and Erin Brockovich’s new company, launching in 2026 — including a consumer health app that will connect people to environmental justice in real-time
      • Connect cross-functional needs into a single, living product vision that keeps us nimble, compliant, and human-centered
      • Enhance reporting capabilities by developing and optimizing Power BI dashboards and reports, leveraging the organization's robust data warehouse to deliver actionable insights and support data-driven decision making

      Tech Leadership That Supports Real Work

      • Manage and evolve a high-performing internal team:
        • Director of Application Development
        • Developers
        • Product Manager
        • Technical Program Manager
      • Coordinate expansion efforts with development firm to manage and enhance our existing platform. You’ll play a key role in shaping its future direction and driving product and technology strategy forward
      • Oversee system performance, scalability, and integration across Salesforce, AWS-hosted custom services, DataWarehouse technologies (i.e. “core platform”), marketing sites, legacy applications, and operations tools
      • Guide architectural decisions and technical tradeoffs across a diverse stack, ensuring solutions are secure, scalable, and cost-effective

      Continuous Improvement and Execution

      • Own the way our platform adapts to change — whether it’s new case types, new partners, or new compliance needs
      • Build better analytics and reporting to drive smarter legal action
      • Support our frontline operations and legal teams with tools that truly make their jobs easier

      Budget and Vendor Management

      • Manage departmental budgets for technology and product functions, including CapEx/OpEx planning
      • Lead vendor selection, negotiation, and relationship management for SaaS tools, cloud services, and external development partners

      Corporate Compliance and Risk Management

      • Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, CCPA) and maintain a strong posture around cybersecurity and system resilience
      • Oversee business continuity planning, access controls, and documentation of system operations and procedures

      Customer Support and Help Desk Oversight

      • Manage an external help desk team responsible for supporting our internal teams
      • Monitor support performance and drive continuous improvement in ticketing systems, documentation, and escalation processes

      Our Technology Environment

      Candidates should bring hands-on experience with—or the ability to quickly ramp up on—a range of technologies that support our business operations and product platforms:

      • Salesforce (preferred): Familiarity with platform customization, automation, and third-party integrations
      • Data Warehousing Tools: Experience supporting or implementing platforms such as DBT (preferred), Snowflake, Redshift, or similar
      • Data Reporting & Visualization: Comfort working with tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker to enable data-driven decisions
      • Cloud Infrastructure (AWS): Understanding of how to leverage AWS services for scalable application hosting, storage, and analytics
      • Custom Applications & APIs: Familiarity with custom development environments, ideally in Python and RESTful API architecture, even if not hands-on
      • Legacy Tools: Motivation to understand how File Maker Pro, which will be sunset in the near future, handles our claims administration for an older tort. Other off-the-shelf tools like docusign and formstack handle portions of the user journey - which you will need to evolve over time

      Who You Are

      • Product-Led. You live for user impact. You care about intuitive experiences, scalable systems, and sweating the details — because someone’s livelihood might depend on it
      • Solution-Oriented. You say “Yes, AND” or “Yes, BUT.” You see obstacles as creative constraints, not dead ends
      • Calm in Chaos. You thrive in an environment where plans change, priorities shift, and the stakes are high
      • Builder & Refiner. You love to ship, but also to refactor. You believe MVPs and excellence can coexist
      • Servant Leader. You believe leadership means lifting others. You love watching your team win
      • Mission-Driven. You want your work to matter — to make the world more fair, more just, more human

      What You Bring

      • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field
      • 8+ years of experience in Product, Technology, or Engineering leadership roles
      • 3+ years managing cross-functional teams, including developers and product managers
      • Salesforce platform experience (preferred)
      • Comfort working with both internal users and external engineering partners
      • Strong technical fluency — enough to question assumptions, propose options, and drive decisions
      • Experience with platforms like Snowflake, AWS, Tableau/Looker/Power BI a plus
      • Legal-tech or legal operations experience preferred, but not required
      • Deep empathy and strong communication skills

      Physical Requirements

      • Frequent need for oral, written, and auditory communication
      • Prolonged periods working on a computer
      • Ability to sit for long periods of time
      • Frequent repetitive hand and wrist motions
      • Ability to work in a fast paced and sometimes stressful services environment
      • Occasional need for travel

      Salary Range: $180,000-$220,000 per year

      This position description should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties as may be required. Perfected Claims LLC and/or Strategic Campaign Sourcing LLC have the right to revise this position description at any time.

      Perfected Claims LLC and Strategic Campaign Sourcing LLC are equal opportunity employers.

      If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please contact us at talent@perfectedclaims.com or you may call us at 340-423-7199 and ask for Human Resources.

      Position: VP of Engineering

      Job Type: Exempt - Full-time

      Schedule: Monday to Friday 9am-6pm EST

      Reports to: Chief Technology Officer

      Eligibility Requirement: Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship

      This role is remote (Occasional quarterly travel may be necessary)

      Summary

      We are seeking a hands-on, player-coach VP Engineering leader to lead Lumata’s engineering function into its next phase of engineering, intelligence, and delivery excellence. You will set technical best practices, work closely with engineers, product team, and be deeply involved in system design, development, engineering operations, and GenAI adoption.

      This role will help define Lumata’s technology identity, instill engineering rigor, and foster a culture of excellence that combines pragmatic execution with long-term architectural thinking. You will lead platform development, AI enablement, and technical delivery across products and services.

      Essential Functions

      Engineering Leadership & Delivery

      • Lead the engineering function across full-stack, UI, backend, platform, QA/SDET, and DevOps teams.
      • Act as a player-coach—partnering with product, cross functional teams and ICs while modeling strong technical judgment
      • Promote engineering rigor through planning, Secure-SDLC, design reviews, code reviews, test automation, documentation practices, and CI/CD excellence.

      Generative AI Adoption & Integration

      • Lead Lumata’s GenAI engineering effort—building internal tools and customer-facing GenAI products.
      • Use GenAI to accelerate internal development, deployment, and compliance workflows.
      • Design and implement AI-augmented delivery workflows, blending human engineers with AI agents.
      • Collaborate with Product and Data to drive GenAI experimentation and impact measurement.

      Platform & Technology Development + Production SRE

      • Implement platform strategy across Salesforce Health Cloud, AWS (Connect, Glue, Lambdas, Data Lake), and EHR integrations with our customers.
      • Own security first, public strength APIs, platform modularity, extensibility, and scale to support diverse GTMs and needs.
      • Champion DevSecOps, infrastructure-as-code, observability, secure, compliant deployment practices and ability to troubleshoot and resolve urgent production issues.

      Team Building & People Leadership

      • Lead a lean blended team of employees and contractors with clear ownership, accountability, and collaboration norms.
      • Design an engineering org that stays lean and high-impact by leveraging automation and GenAI agents where possible.
      • Establish clear roles, impact areas, and growth paths to attract and retain top engineering talent.

      Engineering, IT Operations & Metrics

      • Track and continuously improve engineering health using DORA, Engineering, Quality and GenAI adoption metrics.
      • Build delivery systems and team structures that improve speed, reliability, and confidence across releases.
      • Operate at the intersection of technology leadership, operational excellence, and AI-driven transformation.

      Education And Experience

      • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field (or equivalent practical experience).
      • 15+ years of engineering experience with at least 5 years in a technical leadership role.
      • Proven experience in developing high performance engineering teams and platforms in a high-growth, scale up environment.
      • Demonstrated success in building and integrating GenAI technologies and infrastructure.
      • Experience working in healthtech, HIPAA-compliant environments, SOC-2 Type 2 or platform businesses is a strong plus.
      • Designed and developed solutions for internal efficiencies or external solutions

      Required Skills

      • Strong full-stack system design, end-to-end development skills, Secure-SDLC.
      • Hands-on coding experience in one or more major language (e.g., JS, Java, python, etc)
      • Experienced building Cloud SaaS solutions with Salesforce (Apex, LWC), AWS services, Mobile apps and DevOps/SRE practices.
      • Deep understanding of CI/CD, DevOps, Security, cloud-native architecture, and continuous deployment.
      • Proven ability to build lean, high-performing teams—blended across contractors, employees, and timezones.
      • Comfortable driving tech roadmaps, leading delivery, reviews and digging into details when needed.
      • Metrics and data driven decision making and planning skills (DORA, etc).
      • Strong communicator and collaborator, able to influence across Product, Data, Clinical Ops, and Executive teams.
      • Mindset and hands on experience for innovation and an eye for practical, scalable GenAI application design and development.
      • Leveraging GenAI for scaling internal efficiency and external solutions (Preferred)

      Physical Requirements

      • Must have a home office that is secure and free of distractions (HIPAA-compliant workspace)
      • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
      • Must be able to hear, speak, call and virtually meet
      • Must be able to communicate both verbally and in writing

      Work Environment

      In order to perform the essential functions of this job, you must have a dedicated remote workspace, and a wireless connection with a minimum of 50 Mbps of download speed and 10 Mbps of upload speed of dedicated internet bandwidth for each person working from home; the workspace is private and has low to no noise level as you will be on phone calls with patients. It is very important that your workspace is HIPAA compliant; your company issued laptop/pc must maintain visibility that only you can access as you'll be handling patient data. You are also expected to have your camera on during virtual meetings, therefore, you must be in a designated workspace/room for privacy.

      The above statements are intended to describe the essential functions of the job being performed by the employees assigned to this classification. The duties and responsibilities listed are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. With the evolution of the organization and this role, the responsibilities of this position may change at any time.

      Benefits

      At Lumata Health, we know you are more than just an employee. As we grow, so will our benefits package. We hope you’ll be a part of that growth!

      • Medical, Dental and Vision
      • Paid time off
      • Parental leave
      • ... more additional benefits

      Our Culture

      At Lumata, we foster a dynamic, inclusive, and supportive remote work environment. We prioritize trust, collaboration, and continuous learning, ensuring a healthy work-life balance.

      Collaboration: Stay connected through regular team meetings and open communication.

      Inclusivity: A diverse team where everyone feels welcome and valued.

      Fun Culture: Engage in chats centered around health, wellness, celebrations, and more.

      Recognition: Regular feedback, performance incentives, and growth opportunities.

      Join Lumata and be part of a forward-thinking, remote-first team where your contributions make a difference, and your well-being is prioritized.

      Who We’re Looking For

      • Mission driven
      • Curious
      • Loves learning and developing skills
      • Team player (though we understand you need focus time, too)

      Why Join Us? At Lumata Health, you’ll be part of a forward-thinking team that is dedicated to reshaping the future of healthcare. We offer comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional development. Join us in making a significant impact on patient care and engagement.

      We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. All individuals are encouraged to apply. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at: hr@lumatahealth.com (no unsolicited resumes please). Applicants must submit an application with Lumata Health to be considered for the position.

      Important Notice

      This position does not require a credit report or the submission of any financial information during the application process. Official communications regarding applications and positions will only be sent from an email address ending in @lumatahealth.com. If you receive any communication about your application from an email not ending in @lumatahealth.com, it is fraudulent. Below are some website options where you can report such activity: consumerfinance.gov, reportfraud.ftc.gov, ic3.gov, https://www.usa.gov/where-report-scams

      Please be advised that Lumata Health only accepts resumes for compensation from agencies that have a signed agreement with Lumata Health. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Lumata Health. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

content.cover_letter:
Cristian Rojas
[Your Address]
[City, State, Zip]
[Your Email]
[Your Phone Number]
[Date]

Hiring Manager
Lensa
[Company Address]
New Carrollton, MD

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Functional Tester position at Lensa, as advertised. With a background as an automation specialist and a proven ability to implement innovative solutions that drive productivity, I believe I would be a valuable asset to your team at TestPros.

Throughout my career, I have developed a detail-oriented approach and a strong foundation in engineering and data analysis. My experience with no-code and low-code tools such as Zapier and Make.com enables me to streamline operations effectively, addressing critical challenges that businesses face. For instance, while managing daily operations at Bombom Boss, I successfully implemented workflow improvements and gained a deep understanding of operational inefficiencies, similar to what a Functional Tester would focus on in their role.

During my time as the Restaurant Service Manager at Bottega Group in Beijing, I led high-volume front-of-house operations, where I identified and documented workflows for smoother service handoffs, showcasing my ability to analyze systems and suggest enhancements. This role cultivated my skills in both critical thinking and collaboration, essential attributes for a Functional Tester.

I am enthusiastic about the opportunity to contribute my expertise in automation and my analytical skills to aid in the independent IT assessment solutions that TestPros provides. My proficiency in utilizing data analytics tools like Python and Tableau will also allow me to identify areas for improvement and contribute effectively to your team’s goals.

Moreover, my MBA specialization in Entrepreneurship and Innovation has equipped me with a strategic mindset that complements my technical skills, while my fluency in both English and Spanish enables me to communicate effectively across diverse teams.

I am eager to bring my background in improving operational efficiency and my passion for solving real business problems to your organization. Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how I can contribute to the success of Lensa and TestPros.

Sincerely,
Cristian Rojas

Cristian Rojas  
[Your Address]  
[City, State, Zip]  
[Your Email]  
[Your Phone Number]  
[Date]  

Hiring Manager  
Perfected Claims  
[Company Address]  
Tampa, FL  

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the Head of Product and Technology position at Perfected Claims, as advertised. With a diverse background in automation, engineering, and data analysis, along with a strong commitment to enhancing operational efficiency, I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to shaping the future of justice delivery through innovative product vision and advanced technical leadership.

Throughout my career, I have specialized in leveraging no-code and low-code tools such as Zapier, Make.com, and n8n to streamline operations and improve team productivity in various sectors. In my most recent role as Store Manager at Bombom Boss in Spain, I gained invaluable insight into customer behavior and operational logistics, enabling me to implement workflow improvements that optimized inventory control and team scheduling. This hands-on experience complements my MBA from the University of London, where I focused on Entrepreneurship and Innovation, further strengthening my capability to lead product and technology initiatives.

Additionally, my tenure as an Operations Manager and Restaurant Service Manager in Beijing taught me the importance of efficient systems in fast-paced, high-volume environments. I successfully identified manual inefficiencies and developed documented workflows, which not only enhanced the customer experience but also improved service operations and staff training outcomes. My ability to communicate effectively across diverse teams and cultures, combined with my analytics expertise, including a certification as an IBM Data Analyst, allows me to make data-driven decisions that align with strategic goals.

I am particularly drawn to Perfected Claims because of its commitment to transforming the justice delivery process. I am passionate about solving complex problems through creative and modular automation solutions that create real value for both the organization and its customers. I believe my strong client relationship management skills and strategic planning capabilities will contribute positively to your team.

I am enthusiastic about the possibility of leading product and technology initiatives at Perfected Claims and would love the opportunity to discuss how I can bring my unique background and skills to your organization. Thank you for considering my application. I hope to speak with you soon.

Sincerely,  
Cristian Rojas

Cristian Rojas
[Your Address]
[City, State, ZIP]
[Your Email]
[Your Phone Number]
[Date]

Hiring Manager
Lumata Health
[Company Address]
Raleigh, NC

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the VP of Engineering position at Lumata Health, as advertised. With a solid foundation in engineering, data analysis, and a passion for building efficient, scalable workflows, I believe I am uniquely qualified to lead your engineering function into its next phase of excellence.

Throughout my professional journey, I have honed my skills in automation and operations management, which I believe are crucial for a hands-on, player-coach leader role. My experience as a Store Manager at Bombom Boss allowed me to implement workflow improvements that increased team productivity and operational efficiency within a fast-paced environment. By utilizing no-code/low-code tools such as Zapier and Make.com, I streamlined operations and reduced manual workloads, aligning with Lumata’s goal to excel in engineering and delivery performance.

In my previous role as Operations Manager at Un Livre Café, I successfully addressed inefficiencies in manual processes and developed documented workflows that enhanced service flows and reduced product waste. This experience has equipped me with a deep understanding of how to analyze operations critically and leverage technology to solve complex problems—skills that are directly applicable to your needs at Lumata Health.

Moreover, my commitment to professional development, demonstrated through my recent MBA and various certifications in data analysis and strategic management, underscores my dedication to continuous learning and innovative thinking. I am fluent in English and Spanish, which will enable me to effectively collaborate with diverse teams and clients across various contexts.

I am excited about the possibility of contributing to Lumata Health’s mission to enhance healthcare delivery through intelligence and engineering excellence. I look forward to the opportunity to further discuss how my skills and experiences can help advance your engineering function.

Thank you for considering my application. I am eager to bring my expertise to Lumata Health and help foster an environment of innovation and high performance.

Sincerely,
Cristian Rojas

You're an internal company knowledge assistants. Your job is to answer questions using the files in the Vector Database. Here's how to do it:

Check Vector Database First
- Search for similar test chunks using RAG.
- If you find matches, use them to answer the question. 
- If you find relevant matches and need additional context to support the answer, prioritize retrieving it from documents that share the same metadata "file_id" & "title" before exploring other sources."

No Answer Found?
- Clearly say: "I couldn't find this in the databases"
- Never guess or invent answers.

Example Response:
"Netflix grew revenue in Streaming services by 20% in 2024."
